creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description:
12 engravings depicting the labors of Hercules, matted and framed together:

19a. Pauli, Hollstein 98 i/v  
monogram and date in plate at lower right: [1542 HSB] inscribed in plate at top: [AERVMNAE HERCVLIS]
MARKS: pink stamp on verso, lower left: Lawrason Riggs, Lugt 1756c; also on verso: loan number for 1941 Baltimore exhibition

19b. Pauli, Hollstein 99 ii/ii  
monogram and date in plate at lower left: [1548 / HSB]
inscribed in plate at top: [LEONIS SUFFOCATI EXVVIIS INDVITVR HERCVLES]
MARK: red stamp on verso, upper left: Josef V. Novák (L.1949), sale 1904 -- put in provenance]
inscribed on verso in graphite: VGUX [code for Prouté, Paris--put in provenance]

19c. Pauli, Hollstein 100 i/iv  
monogram and date in plate at upper right: [1545 HSB]
inscribed in plate at top: [HERCVLES VNA CVM IOLAO HYDRAM OCCIDIT]
MARKS: pink stamp on verso, lower left: Lawrason Riggs, Lugt 1756c; black stamp on verso, lower left: Robert Scholtz, Lugt 2241; blue stamp on verso, lower right: Georg Hamminger, Lugt 1159; black stamp at lower center, undefined, possibly Hans von und zu Aufsess (L.2749), sale 1913. Also on verso: loan number for 1941 Baltimore exhibition.

19d. Pauli, Hollstein 101 iiii/iii  
monogram and date in plate at upper left: [1545 / HSB]
inscribed in plate at top: [GADITANAS COLVMNAS STATVIT HERCVLES]
inscribed on verso in graphite: C.30365 [code for Colnaghi, London--put in provenance]

19e. Pauli, Hollstein 102 ?/iv  
monogram and date in plate at upper left: [1545 / HSB]
inscribed in plate at top: [CACVM FLAMMIVOMVM OPPRIMIT HERCVLES]
MARKS: blue stamp on verso, lower left: unidentified collector's mark (Lugt 1940) (unidentified)

19f. Pauli, Hollstein 103 i/iv  
monogram and date in plate at lower left: [1545 / HSB]
inscribed in plate at top: [ANTAEVM LIBIAE GYGANTEM SVFFOCAT HERCVLES]
MARKS: pink stamp on verso, lower left: Lawrason Riggs, Lugt 1756c. Also on verso: loan number for 1941 Baltimore exhibition.

19g. Pauli, Hollstein 104 i-ii/iii  
monogram and date in plate
marks: Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamps See under Description
provenance: [Various previous collections; see under Description.] John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Labors of Hercules
